alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 4:00PM CDT until April 13 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Mississippi County in eastern Arkansas... Crockett County in western Tennessee... Tipton County in western Tennessee... Southeastern Dyer County in western Tennessee... Southwestern Gibson County in western Tennessee... Lauderdale County in western Tennessee... Haywood County in western Tennessee... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 400 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Covington, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Brownsville, Covington, Ripley, Fort Pillow State Park, Munford, Brighton, Alamo, Bells, Halls, Nutbush, Forked Deer, Hillville, Fulton, Chestnut Bluff, Belle Eagle, Holly Grove, Dixonville, Eaton, Dancyville and Ashport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and western Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and western Tennessee.
